intro: Philippia hexandra, commonly known as the African violet or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial shade to full sun depending on the climate. Philippia hexandra is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
